Signal intermediate throw event
The "Signal intermediate throw event" element is a
signal source
and is used for synchronizing parallel flows and exchanging information.
The signal source in the system is implemented by the
"WorkFlow. Initiator event Signal"
type.
In the business process diagram, the signal source is represented by
.
Signal transmission can be configured both within elements of the same business process as well as across different business processes (subprocesses).
To configure the signal, the following are required:
signal source (intermediate event):
signal receiver (e.g.,
Start Signal Event
or
Signal Intermediate Catch Event Handler
).
To configure the signal parameters, save the business process diagram, then click the
button in the stage menu: a modal window with the set of parameters for configuration will open.
Setting
Purpose
"Signal settings" tab
Object state
Selecting the object state from the System directory.
Algorithm to define an object
Selecting
algorithm
to define the object that will receive the signal.
If no algorithm is specified, the signal handler will search for all objects with active processes.
Signal
Defining the relation with the
handler
for signal transmission configuration.
The source and signal handler are matched according to the value specified in the "Signal" field. If no values are provided in this field,
the element names in the diagram must be identical
.
Acts within a process instance
Boolean parameter that restricts signal distribution outside the process instance:
when the switch is active, signal handling occurs within this diagram (the source and receiver must be in the same business process diagram);
when the switch is inactive, signal handling occurs in multiple diagrams (source and receiver can be in different business processes).
